issue.title: Inconsistent exception spec for basic_string move constructor

discussion.p: Sub-clause contains these constructors in paragraphs 2 and 3:

blockquote.p:
[…]
-3- Throws: The second form throws nothing if the allocator's move constructor throws nothing.

discussion.p:
How can it ever throw anything if it is marked noexcept?
Further, according to paragraph 18 of the same sub-clause:

blockquote.pre: basic_string(const basic_string& str, const Allocator& alloc); basic_string(basic_string&& str, const Allocator& alloc);

blockquote.p:
[…]
-18- Throws: The second form throws nothing if alloc == str.get_allocator() unless the copy constructor for Allocator throws.

discussion.p: The constraint "unless the copy constructor for Allocator throws" is redundant, because according to Table 28 — Allocator requirements, the expressions
impose the requirement: "Shall not exit via an exception".
